Package serverside.gamehandler

Interface GameHandler

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    GameHandlerMethod
    public interface GameHandler
    The game handler responsible for handling the messages sent by the client and sending messages to the client when in a game of Pentago. Whenever a client gets in a game, a new GameHandler object is created for the client. Before the game has started and after the game has ended the ClientHandler handles the client's messages.

      • getToQueue

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition getToQueue()
        This method is used to access the toQueue condition used by this class which indicates if a client is in a queue.
        Returns:
        toQueue which is the condition to indicate if a client is in a Queue.

      • getToWaitAgain

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition getToWaitAgain()
        This method is used to access the toWaitAgain condition used by this class which indicates to the client when they should wait until making a queuing request again.
        Returns:
        toWaitAgain which is the condition to indicate if a client is still waiting to be queued

      • getToPlay

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition getToPlay()
        This method is used to access the getToPlay condition used by this class which indicates if 2 clients are in a queue and are ready to play.
        Returns:
        toPlay which is a condition that indicates if 2 clients are waiting in the queue to play a game.

      • getBoardSignal

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition getBoardSignal()
        This method is used to access the boardSignal condition used by different classes which indicates if the game has made a signal or done a specific task.
        Returns:
        boardSignal which is the condition to indicate if a game has made a signal

        java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition getToDone()
        This method is used to access the condition toDone which indicates if the client has just finished a game.
        Returns:
        toDone which is a condition indicating if the client has just finished a game.

        This method is used to remove the client from a game.
